column4: on ubuntu, fdisk /dev/<usb dongle device>, you should see a single partition; you can then make it bootable with the appropriate command (don't remember it right now)
the tricky part is identifying the /dev/ entry for the usb key. If you operate on the wrong device, you could mess up your system disk!
dmesg a few times after plugging in the usb key, you'll see what device the kernel assigns to it. HTH
